top_categories.workout_context: Hungry Bear 100's northwoods gravel roads rewards steady threshold power. Surging and recovering costs more watts than just holding.
At mile 60 of 100, glycogen is gone. This workout teaches your body to produce watts on fumes.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Hungry Bear 100. Train it until it feels boring.
At Hungry Bear 100, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
Hungry Bear 100's Gravel roads, Northwoods terrain forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 100 miles.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Hungry Bear 100's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before May.
When someone attacks on northwoods gravel roads, you have 10 seconds to respond or you're off the back. This builds that response.
Every hard session works better with a bigger aerobic base. At 100 miles, base fitness is the difference between racing and surviving.
100 miles rewards fat oxidation. This volume work shifts your fuel mix so you're still burning fat at hour 5, not bonking at hour 3.
Two threshold sessions per week without the recovery cost of VO2max work. For 100 miles, sustainable FTP gains matter more than peak power.
Endurance with intensity spikes baked in. Exactly what 4,500ft of climbing on northwoods gravel roads does to your power file on race day.
Varied gradients on northwoods gravel roads demand climbing versatility. Sit the shallow stuff, stand the steep stuff, switch without thinking.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for Hungry Bear 100’s 100 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Hungry Bear 100 requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on northwoods gravel roads to build confidence. Expect: gravel roads, northwoods terrain, rolling to hilly.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, Durability, and G Spot to prepare you for 100 miles of northwoods gravel roads in Cable, Wisconsin.
